name: Garlic and Basil Goat Cheese
author: Ranchgurl
summary: This goat cheese is so good that you won't want to stop eating it! I've been making it for years and it has always been a favorite in my family.
directions: Pour the goat's milk into a large pot
Cook over medium-high heat until small bubbles form, and the milk becomes foamy
Do not bring to a boil
Remove from the heat, and stir in the vinegar; let stand 10 minutes to curdle
Line a colander with a double layer of cheesecloth
Pour the curdled milk into the cheesecloth to separate the curds from the whey
Gather up the sides of the cheesecloth, and gently squeeze as much remaining whey from the curds as you can
Place the cheese into a mixing bowl, and stir in basil and garlic
Season to taste with salt, then cover, and refrigerate until cold
